name: Mercure Reims Centre Cathedrale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one night at this hotel on our way through France and found it to be really comfortable, clean and a little funky with all the colours in both the rooms and in the hotel in general. The Staff that we came into contact with were very helpful and friendly, and the hotel is situated fairly close to the centre of town so easy to reach by foot. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Reims is a very beautiful and historic city, and worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a great 2 night stay in a junior suite. It was modern, clean, and staff were very friendly. I used the secure underground car park which was easy and had plenty of spaces.
reviews.title: Going downmarket

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was fresh and had lots of variety.
reviews.title: 4 star quality room, pub quality food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has some good points and bad points,
reviews.title: Good points and bad points

reviews.text: The bad - we had to change our room as the toilet seat was broken, the second room had a badly stained toilet bowl either not cleaned regularly or needing renewed, the corridor on third floor was smelly, probably from the carpet. my wife and I had to share a welcome gift of a small bottle of water!!!! the hotel offers a fridge and we had chilled a bottle of wine, however when I asked the barman for a loan of a bottle opener he refused point blank by taking it out of his pocket showed me it and said its mine only.....Why offer a fridge if you don't want guests bringing in their own drink?????? The hotel is a good few streets away from the centre which I wouldn't be happy for my wife to walk at night. The breakfast is vastly overpriced for what's on offer.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms for a fair price

reviews.text: The good - hotel overlooks the canal and looks modern, the beds and shower are good. some staff are very friendly.
reviews.title: A few problems but overall a good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a cathedral view which was lovely. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Do wish hotels would put a mirror over whatever they choose to call a desk or dressing table though as it's so frustrating having to stand to do make up and hair. good parking facility soe us as we had a roof box and many hotels have restricted height parking. We found a spot in front of the hotel and there was also on street parking. The hotel also has underground parking.
reviews.title: Very nice, great view

reviews.text: We had a problem with one or 2 minoor things, one of which was the A/C. The hotel immediately apologised and offered us free breakfast.
reviews.title: Awful stuffy hotel with patronising hotel manager. I recommend booking Sofitel Suites Cathedral instead.

reviews.text: This is a very old hotel, with faulty aircon/heating system & stuffy rooms: must have been awful pre-refurbishment! We stayed in room 502 and despite raining all night (mild 19 degrees C) the room was boiling hot so much so we couldn't sleep with the heat. Can't open window either because of Mosquitos from river and noise from main road across. In the morning the hotel manager simply said that if we're not happy with our room we should change hotel - which is exactly what we did (to Sofitel). He was extremely patronising, no apologies, no nice gesture such as offer another room, cheaper rate for the list night or breakfast. I'm surprised he didn't escorted us out!
reviews.title: Good breakfast and clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has clean and nice rooms. Very good breakfast and friendly staff - although speaking English is not the favorite choice for a Frenchman.
reviews.title: 1 day stay on the way to Provence - perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From my room there was a great view to the river with houseboats and the rowers. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the Cathedral and the pedestrian zone, so if you have small children it might be a long walk, if you don’t have a buggy.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: This hotel is extremely well located with only a short walk to the centre of town and easy access to the Champagne region.
reviews.title: Great but too Hot for an Australian

reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed and some, including ours, even have a view out over the river. Staff were reasonably friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good base for Champagne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is based upon my experiences recently. Other travellers may be more fortunate.
reviews.title: Mercure in name only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I selected the Reims Mercure as I love the brand and its position near to the Cathedral was perfect for us. There was choice but my trips to other Mercures have always been excellent so it seemed reasonable to assume the same standard applied across the chain.
reviews.title: Good cost benefit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exterior - nothing to shout about. In fact, it did nothing for me at all.
reviews.title: Checked into a dirty room with no air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking - plenty but at the time of my visit it was difficult to access because of works. Not the hotel's fault so no deductions for that.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable, nothing to get excited about

description: The Mercure Reims Centre Cathédrale is located in the heart of the center, close to exit 24 of the A4 highway, the TGV train station, the convention center and the tourist area around the cathedral. This modern hotel offers 126 air-conditioned rooms, 12 meeting and conference rooms, a restaurant and bar and a private paying car park. We are open 24/7 to welcome guests.
